name: Old Brewery Guest House

reviews.text: On arrival not a very friendly lady more interested in walking her dog and not being around for help. Room was nice overlooking green except my bed I could feel every spring - it needs a new one, Bathroom needs a good clean with bleach, toothbrush and hot water round parts of shower ledges and tiles, the vanity top in sink had soap slime left at the back, and tiles needed cleaning of old tile adhesive, mould and again a hot soapy wash, Also after walking we needed a hot bath no water and NObody around to help. It seems we were not the only ones with this problem. The breakfast was very good and the ladies were very nice. As it is SherpaVan Guest House they need to sort out these problems
reviews.title: C2C STOP

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really enjoyed our two night stay. Very comfortable accommodation and the breakfast was excellent. The staff did a fine job looking after us. Quite a stunning location and only five minute walk to the town centre and pubs. Would highly recommend.
reviews.title: Lovely place

reviews.text: We had a fabulous time at this gorgeous B n B. The service was excellent, the staff were very helpful and went out of their way to make our stay relaxing and enjoyable. The rooms were fantastic and we were treated to delicious hot cooked breakfasts each morning. The breakfast menu was extentsive with everything from fruit and cereals to the full cooked English breakfast with black pudding!
reviews.title: Gorgeous B n B in a quaint little town in North Yorkshire

reviews.text: We would definitely stay here again and would recommend this place to our friends and family.
reviews.title: a unique B&B

reviews.text: Alicia Russell. Melbourne
reviews.title: Interesting place - wish I'd had more time

reviews.text: lovely and clean room, with tea and coffee facilities. Owners very hospitable on arrival,offering milk for your room on arrival. Large twin room even though occupied by 1 person. Nice and quiet as Market Place can get noisy on weekends. Would stay again. Fell in love though.....with Harry the 12month old Boxer (only because I have one myself)...
reviews.title: quaint guest house

reviews.text: Great value for money......Hotels in Richmond charge a lot more
reviews.title: C2C August 2012 Janet (Australia) & Judith (England)

reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay at the Old Brewery Guest House on the C2C. It provided all we needed, our twin room was comfortable and the en-suite with lots of hot water was appreciated as that was the night we washed our hair! The garden well cared for and I enjoyed the surroundings. Breakfast was superb and served at our requested time. We were happy after a long walking day to relax, watch TV and have an early night and this accommodation provided all that for us. I would stay there again and recommend it to other walkers. Janet (Qld)
reviews.title: Better value places than here

reviews.text: We stayed here before doing the coast 2 coast.
reviews.title: Perfect for Coast to Coast walkers

reviews.text: This was the second most expensive place on the route and was below average value.
reviews.title: A bit shoddy--- avoid room 7a!

reviews.text: The breakfast was very nice.
reviews.title: Needs shaking up...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Suggestions to the Guest House owners:
reviews.title: Would definitely return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. Given that your Post Code produces a different address to that on your website have someone on the end of the phone that can actually provide directions rather than saying "I have only been here a week I don't know the way myself". So too when a guest asks for directions to a restaurant. The lady was very sweet and apologetic but lacked any kind of basic knowledge.
reviews.title: Great Place to stay

reviews.text: 2. Turn on heating in guests bedrooms - particularly in January. I was F R O Z E N
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: 3. Illuminate the court yard such that guests can see the myriad of trip hazards, like the tree growing out of the pavement in front of the door to the rear buildings and all the pot plants. It is black as a witches hat at night and its a death trap.
reviews.title: Convenient location

reviews.text: A fairly grumpy welcome as I arrived at 10.30pm - ok, that was late in the evening - but nothing had told me that wasn't acceptable. Bedroom had obviously been renovated, but still mess in wardrobe, mixed 2nd-hand coat hangers - all rather 1970s in content. Bed comfortable. Had to retune TV as it only had one channel. (It now has 80-odd). Breakfast good, but took 25 minutes to come. Check-out slow. Would I go again? Yes, if there was nowhere else available, but in Richmond I suspect there are lots of other places.
reviews.title: OK, but a bit 1970s in content and service

reviews.text: A one night business stop here was odd to say the least. The place was locked up when I arrived with a contact number on the door. I called it then had to wait until the person (owner?)finished walking their dog before I could check-in.
reviews.title: Strange but okay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception desk area was a bit scruffy and I was tempted to say 'forget it' but I went with the flow and the room was fine. Nice and clean facing onto a traditional village green with a big old horse chestnut tree in the middle; very picturesque. A decent sleep was disturbed by firstly early risers and a squeaky front door (get some oil please), followed by the radio alarm going off in the next room at full volume even though the room was unoccupied.
reviews.title: Very convenient for Coast to Coast and perfectly adequate
Disappointed!
reviews.text: The breakfast was odd. The staff were more interested in last nights telly and his out in the kitchen but were very courteous when they did attend to you. The menu for breakfast was magnificent; I've never seen so much choice in a small place like this.
If everything was as well prepared as my eggs benedict they must have a lot of return custom.
reviews.title: Very exclusive pit stop

aka: Old Brewery Guest House Hotel Richmond
description: A stones throw from the River Swale, at the foot of Alan the Reds magnificent castle (circa 1070) and just a few minutes from the largest cobbled market place in Britain, the house retains its old world charm, is tastefully decorated, and offers every modern comfort. Each guest room enjoys attractive views and has a private bathroom or shower room. Guests also have the use of the communal sitting room with an open fire, TV, and a small library of books and periodicals. Guests are also free to relax in our peaceful patio garden.
